entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 04 at 5:17PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Brief Landspout Tornadoes Possible... At 515 PM MDT, conditions are becoming favorable for the development of landspout tornadoes in and close to to a Flagler to Arapahoe line. However, at this time it is unknown which if any storm would produce a landspout. Any landspouts which develop are expected to pose a limited threat.

entry.title: Flood Watch issued June 04 at 2:51PM MDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: .Another round of widespread heavy rain will move through eastern Washington and northern Idaho late tonight through Sunday. Soils are fairly saturated and will see additional precipitation. Flash Flooding will be of high concern especially near recent burn scars which are particularly vulnerable to debris flows and mud slides. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING...

entry.title: Severe Weather Statement issued June 04 at 7:30PM EDT until June 04 at 8:15PM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...THE SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING FOR SOMERSET COUNTY IS CANCELLED... The storms which prompted the warning have weakened below severe limits, but cloud to ground lightning and heavy downpours are still likely. Small hail and heavy rain are also still possible with this thunderstorm.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 04 at 7:13PM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Locally heavy showers and isolated thunderstorms will continue into early this evening... Showers and isolated thunderstorms, accompanied by locally heavy rain, will continue early this evening. The heavy rainfall may result in ponding of water on area roads. Motorists are urged to exercise caution and adjust speed accordingly.

entry.title: Hydrologic Outlook issued June 04 at 9:47AM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Bitterroot River in Ravalli and Missoula counties is expected to rise to near minor flood stage... The Clark Fork above Missoula is forecast to rise to around minor flood

entry.summary: ...HEAT INDEX VALUES BETWEEN 105 AND 109 DEGREES ARE EXPECTED TODAY... The combination of warm temperatures and high dewpoints will produce heat indices between 105 and 109 degrees today. Residents with outdoor activities planned are urged to drink plenty of water, wear light weight and light colored clothing and take frequent breaks from the heat.
